description: The `synthetic.project_comments` table represents comments associated with specific projects and tasks, capturing commentary details such as the comment text, author, and timestamps for creation and updates. Each comment is uniquely identified by `comment_id` and may have a hierarchical structure indicated by `parent_comment_id`, linking comments to potential parent comments for threaded discussions. The foreign keys suggest a reference to undefined tables, possibly pointing to related project or task entities, highlighting its role in facilitating collaboration and communication within the larger project management schema.

columns.name: comment_id
columns.description: This column uniquely identifies each comment associated with a project, ensuring distinct tracking and management. Each value represents a sequentially generated identifier for a project comment entry.

columns.name: project_id
columns.description: This column likely identifies the specific project associated with each comment entry, with each number corresponding to a unique project. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: task_id
columns.description: This column likely represents the identification number for tasks associated with project comments. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: parent_comment_id
columns.description: This column likely indicates the identifier of a comment that another comment is responding to, forming a hierarchical or threaded structure for discussions. If the value is null, the comment may be an original post rather than a reply.

columns.name: comment_text
columns.description: This column contains written observations or reflections, possibly related to media, culture, education, and other general topics. The purpose is unclear from the available data.

columns.name: author_id
columns.description: This column represents the unique identifier of users who have authored comments on projects. Each integer corresponds to a distinct author, though specific roles or attributes of these authors are not discernible from the available data.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a comment was created on a project, reflecting the moment of its initial entry into the system. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column captures the date and time when a particular comment on a project was last modified. It helps in tracking the most recent updates to comments within project discussions.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX project_comments_pkey ON synthetic.project_comments USING btree (comment_id)
